verses.text_plain: In the third year of Cyrus king of Persia a thing was revealed unto Daniel, whose name was called Belteshazzar; and the thing was true, but the time appointed was long: and he understood the thing, and had understanding of the vision.
verses.verse_html:
1In the third year of Cyrus king of Persia a thing was revealed unto Daniel, whose name was called Belteshazzar; and the thing was true, but the time appointed was long: and he understood the thing, and had understanding of the vision. ▼
▼ long: Heb. great

verses.text_plain: In those days I Daniel was mourning three full weeks.
verses.verse_html:
2In those days I Daniel was mourning three full weeks. ▼
▼ full…: Heb. weeks of days

footnotes.body_html: ▼ full…: Heb. weeks of days

verses.text_plain: I ate no pleasant bread, neither came flesh nor wine in my mouth, neither did I anoint myself at all, till three whole weeks were fulfilled.
verses.verse_html:
3I ate no pleasant bread, neither came flesh nor wine in my mouth, neither did I anoint myself at all, till three whole weeks were fulfilled. ▼
▼ pleasant…: Heb. bread of desires

footnotes.body_html: ▼ pleasant…: Heb. bread of desires

verses.text_plain: And in the four and twentieth day of the first month, as I was by the side of the great river, which is Hiddekel;
verses.verse_html: 4And in the four and twentieth day of the first month, as I was by the side of the great river, which is Hiddekel;

tokens.text: as I was by the side

verses.text_plain: Then I lifted up mine eyes, and looked, and behold a certain man clothed in linen, whose loins were girded with fine gold of Uphaz:
verses.verse_html:
5Then I lifted up mine eyes, and looked, and behold a certain man clothed in linen, whose loins were girded with fine gold of Uphaz: ▼
▼ a…: Heb. one man

footnotes.body_html: ▼ a…: Heb. one man

verses.text_plain: His body also was like the beryl, and his face as the appearance of lightning, and his eyes as lamps of fire, and his arms and his feet like in colour to polished brass, and the voice of his words like the voice of a multitude.
verses.verse_html: 6His body also was like the beryl, and his face as the appearance of lightning, and his eyes as lamps of fire, and his arms and his feet like in colour to polished brass, and the voice of his words like the voice of a multitude.

verses.text_plain: And I Daniel alone saw the vision: for the men that were with me saw not the vision; but a great quaking fell upon them, so that they fled to hide themselves.
verses.verse_html: 7And I Daniel alone saw the vision: for the men that were with me saw not the vision; but a great quaking fell upon them, so that they fled to hide themselves.

tokens.text: upon them, so that they fled

verses.text_plain: Therefore I was left alone, and saw this great vision, and there remained no strength in me: for my comeliness was turned in me into corruption, and I retained no strength.
verses.verse_html:
8Therefore I was left alone, and saw this great vision, and there remained no strength in me: for my comeliness was turned in me into corruption, and I retained no strength. ▼
▼ comeliness: or, vigour

verses.text_plain: Yet heard I the voice of his words: and when I heard the voice of his words, then was I in a deep sleep on my face, and my face toward the ground.
verses.verse_html: 9Yet heard I the voice of his words: and when I heard the voice of his words, then was I in a deep sleep on my face, and my face toward the ground.

tokens.text: then was I in a deep sleep

verses.text_plain: And, behold, an hand touched me, which set me upon my knees and upon the palms of my hands.
verses.verse_html:
10And, behold, an hand touched me, which set me upon my knees and upon the palms of my hands. ▼
▼ set: Heb. moved

verses.text_plain: And he said unto me, O Daniel, a man greatly beloved, understand the words that I speak unto thee, and stand upright: for unto thee am I now sent. And when he had spoken this word unto me, I stood trembling.
verses.verse_html:
11And he said unto me, O Daniel, a man greatly beloved, understand the words that I speak unto thee, and stand upright: for unto thee am I now sent. And when he had spoken this word unto me, I stood trembling. ▼
▼ greatly…: Heb. of desires
 , ▼
▼ upright: Heb. upon thy standing

tokens.text: for unto thee am I now sent

footnotes.body_html: ▼ greatly…: Heb. of desires
▼ upright: Heb. upon thy standing

verses.text_plain: Then said he unto me, Fear not, Daniel: for from the first day that thou didst set thine heart to understand, and to chasten thyself before thy God, thy words were heard, and I am come for thy words.
verses.verse_html: 12Then said he unto me, Fear not, Daniel: for from the first day that thou didst set thine heart to understand, and to chasten thyself before thy God, thy words were heard, and I am come for thy words.

verses.text_plain: But the prince of the kingdom of Persia withstood me one and twenty days: but, lo, Michael, one of the chief princes, came to help me; and I remained there with the kings of Persia.
verses.verse_html:
13But the prince of the kingdom of Persia withstood me one and twenty days: but, lo, Michael, one of the chief princes, came to help me; and I remained there with the kings of Persia. ▼
▼ chief: or, first

verses.text_plain: Now I am come to make thee understand what shall befall thy people in the latter days: for yet the vision is for many days.
verses.verse_html: 14Now I am come to make thee understand what shall befall thy people in the latter days: for yet the vision is for many days.

verses.text_plain: And when he had spoken such words unto me, I set my face toward the ground, and I became dumb.
verses.verse_html: 15And when he had spoken such words unto me, I set my face toward the ground, and I became dumb.

verses.text_plain: And, behold, one like the similitude of the sons of men touched my lips: then I opened my mouth, and spake, and said unto him that stood before me, O my lord, by the vision my sorrows are turned upon me, and I have retained no strength.
verses.verse_html: 16And, behold, one like the similitude of the sons of men touched my lips: then I opened my mouth, and spake, and said unto him that stood before me, O my lord, by the vision my sorrows are turned upon me, and I have retained no strength.

tokens.text: upon me, and I have retained

verses.text_plain: For how can the servant of this my lord talk with this my lord? for as for me, straightway there remained no strength in me, neither is there breath left in me.
verses.verse_html:
17For how can the servant of this my lord talk with this my lord? for as for me, straightway there remained no strength in me, neither is there breath left in me. ▼
▼ the…: or, this servant of my lord

tokens.text: in me, neither is there breath

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the…: or, this servant of my lord
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the…: or, this servant of my lord

verses.text_plain: Then there came again and touched me one like the appearance of a man, and he strengthened me,
verses.verse_html: 18Then there came again and touched me one like the appearance of a man, and he strengthened me,

verses.text_plain: And said, O man greatly beloved, fear not: peace be unto thee, be strong, yea, be strong. And when he had spoken unto me, I was strengthened, and said, Let my lord speak; for thou hast strengthened me.
verses.verse_html: 19And said, O man greatly beloved, fear not: peace be unto thee, be strong, yea, be strong. And when he had spoken unto me, I was strengthened, and said, Let my lord speak; for thou hast strengthened me.

verses.text_plain: Then said he, Knowest thou wherefore I come unto thee? and now will I return to fight with the prince of Persia: and when I am gone forth, lo, the prince of Grecia shall come.
verses.verse_html: 20Then said he, Knowest thou wherefore I come unto thee? and now will I return to fight with the prince of Persia: and when I am gone forth, lo, the prince of Grecia shall come.

tokens.text: unto thee? and now will I return
and when I am gone forth

verses.text_plain: But I will shew thee that which is noted in the scripture of truth: and there is none that holdeth with me in these things, but Michael your prince.
verses.verse_html:
21But I will shew thee that which is noted in the scripture of truth: and there is none that holdeth with me in these things, but Michael your prince. ▼
▼ holdeth: Heb. strengtheneth himself

tokens.text: with me in these things, but Michael

footnotes.body_html: ▼ holdeth: Heb. strengtheneth himself
